intro: Impatiens austroyunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan touch-me-not, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant is herbaceous, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy in texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions of Yunnan province. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturalists alike.
